author: Mike Kearney
comment: Within Five minutes of installing this game I knew it was going to get a five star rating from me, but I decide to give it a bit of time to see if my feelings changed.  They did. Now I'm upset I can't give it a sixth star. Keep up the great work you're developing an amazing game.
title: Best wear game!!!

author: Almahdi Morris Quet
comment: I love the concept and I find its a great game already! Impressive how you could make a real game fit on such a small screen!Would love to see some sort of zoom function for the phone so it occupies whole screen or maybe have it display the map on screen. Speaking of map would be great to be able to move while in map mode! Edit: a big thank you for lowering difficulty! Ty for bug fixing so much to explore

reply.author: AQ
reply.content:
Thank you, we read everyone and take everything relevant into account.
Difficulty has already been lowered, but will be under continuous adjustment for a while.
The mobile/handheld UI will be improved sooner or later since we choose to first focus on the backend and the Android Wear version.

title: Great concept

author: Ernest Balak
comment: Sadly I can't see anything. The game takes up about 1/5th of my screen and the rest is black.. I can't read the tiny options. I'm willing to re-rate the game after this is fixed.  Until then I can't even play it to give it a better score.
title: Looks like fun..

author: Seano TheBoon
comment: The game IS a decent rpg for Android especially for the price but it's not perfect. The controls take a lot of getting used to and the screen should be able to be fullscreen or adjustable. I find the current setting just a bit too small. Also LOSING stats randomly on level up? Yeah no. That's an awful idea. Ive seen it before, it literally makes no sense.
title: OK I get how it works now! Still not impressed yet.

author: Anna Peshkess
comment: I've been playing this for a while now, my characters are all level 8 or 9. I finally got to the elevator, and took it down to the 4th floor. On the 4th floor, I could no longer access the elevator I had been riding, but there was a second elevator nearby. However, this elevator seems to be broken. It doesn' have buttons like the first one, and nothing happens when I swipe to the right. Also, I can't get to stairs from where I'm at, and I can't find any hidden doors. Why did the first elevator disappear??
title: Super fun, but stuck!

author: Steve Alston
comment: I will support this project and even invest in it. This is the type of game that not only is  a missing/hidden genre of RPG for Android bit to have it on the go on your watch is amazing. I can't put the game down.
title: This is what you NEED to have.

author: Justin
comment: Fantastic. Runs perfectly on LG G Watch. Controls and gameplay need some time to get used to, but once you do, it's amazing. It's a shame the devs haven't updated the app in a year, because I think they can make an incredible game even better.

author: R3dd3su
comment: This is what developers should be doing with wear games instead of just tic tac toe. The game is  very nostalgic of the old PC adventure games. I'm glad to see a developer thinking outside the box. This is great.
title: Amazingly ambitious

author: Owen Boyer
comment: Im stuck in a area on the second floor with no way to stairs. Map shows section im in seperate from main maze second floor

author: Paul Rivera
comment: Please some insight would be much appreciated :)

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Paul. The blue tile on the map is a magic elevator but you cannot reach it from the first level of the maze. The gray tiles are just placeholder at the moment. You cannot rest (like in the Inn) in the maze, but you can set up a camp to inspect, equip and reorder your party though.

title: I just wish I knew what the different color tiles are for in the dungeon. Like the blue ones and gray tiles etc. Also how can I rest or can I in the Maze?

author: Jake
comment: This game is amazing I love it! Is there anyway to play full screen my phone? The screen on the phone is smaller than even on my wear device!
title: Amazing / Question

author: Paige Rocco Olevich
comment: Can't get to training ground wish I could give it 0 stars!!!!!!!!!!!
title: Hated

author: Jake Hamilton
comment: I realize this is for wear but i really enjoy it. Maybe make a full screen android phone port?

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Jake, it is planned and I am working on it at the moment, I will also drastically improve the UX on wear too, among other things.

author: Spotty Mushroom
comment: I am a big dungeons and dragons fan, and think that this is a VERY fun game to play. And I especially like the character creation. The only bad thing is that there is only a couple of classes.  Please add more!!!  OH AND MOST IMPORTANTLY!!!  there is a glitch while opening chests were you can't select anything please fix it!!!
title: Awesome

author: Tam Ngo
comment: Using it on the Moto 360, it takes multiple taps to make it select things, especially the pop-up menus. Also, notice a strange effect during selection taps where the image appears to zoom in and then zoom out, very quickly. It doesn't seem intentional so it must be a bug. Keep working on it!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thanks, this should be fixed on latest update. Please, try again and change your rating.

title: Nice effort, still only mediocre

author: Brion Fallon
comment: Awesome game.  By far the best game for wear and its still being developed!  The devs are hands on.  If you even remotely think this game will entertain you.... buy it.  You wont be let down.  Thanks developers. You guys are setting the pace!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you, this should be fixed from now on. Please, try again and change your rating.

title: Sa-weet!

author: Jacob Robison
comment: The game looked really good but once I installed it it wouldn't work on the wear touches don't seem to respond, anyway to get my money back? Thank you.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Hi Jacob, touch issue has been fixed months ago. Of course you can get your money back, please send me your email and your order number so we can proceed with your refund.

title: Looked good

author: Ryan Lee
comment: I just got the game today but i wonder if there is a way to make the game use all of my phone's screen. I know the game was made for a Wear but i hope you can help

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Hi Ryan, the phone version is just a bonus, the game is not designed to suit well such a big screen as a phone screen. But in the next releases, I will try to provide an option to zoom on handheld device, however this is not high in priority and some image will probably result in being very blurry.

title: Hm?

author: Lee Weaver
comment: So many great elements but also a great amount of room for improvement. Needs forum to cultivate ideas for improvement. Come on buddy giv us an update!!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you Lee, added to the TODO list. Next update, when using a healing spell, the characters HP and HP MAX will be displayed instead of showing their class which is not relevant for this scenario.

title: A possible classic in the making

author: Mark Mcneice
comment: Great game healing potions don't seem to work for me. I take a potion and it ends the battle and no healing

author: Billy Gray
comment: This is a great start to a great game. It needs improvement but it is amazing and worth paying for if you don't mind a learning curve. Support is awesome. I had an issue creating characters and e-mailed them. They responded really quick and now I'm playing a lot.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content:
Thank you! Difficulty has been lowered again, and is under continuous adjustment.
We choose the approach in order to reach a decent equilibrium to not start from a low difficulty and then raise it, but the contrary. More is coming, and more frequently!

title: 4 star for the potential

author: gareth holmes
comment: Creating a quick game or resuming crashes on gwatch r so haven't got to gameplay yet. Looks good but struggles a bit with the round screen.  UPDATE: starting a game on the phone allowed syncing to a game in progress at the tavern. Starting a new game on the watch crashed it again.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thanks, this should be fixed on latest update. Please, try again and change your rating.

title: Crashes on gwatchr

author: Michael Arnold
comment: Support is always awesome very active Developer. Emailed a few problems in and Dev responded right away and was already fixing the issue.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content:
Indeed, because it was a bug! You have to level up to gain more maximum HP.
Remember from alpha to beta to final, the road is long and you might encounter more bugs than monsters until beta.
Thank you for your precious feedback (and check the Credits, you're in!).

title: Helpful Dev

author: Robert Williams
comment: I don't get it. Is it 14 year old geeks with bottle top glasses the ones saying this game is cool. Because I got the game thinking it would be a swords and serpents type game. But you can't even read the text. I have a galaxy note phone big and the game plays in a small box in the middle of my screen wtf. Guess you got me this time dev enjoy my hard earned money!

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: The fact you can also play on a regular device is just a "bonus". Most of the times it's the contrary, you will find an app that supports a regular device and the bonus is to support little screens as we have on smartwatches. We thought that instead of providing only a version for Android Wear, we could also bring it to regular device too, simply.

title: Castle wear

author: sportsquid
comment: I have been playing this game for awhile now, and can say without a doubt this has more potential than any other wear game. After the updates thte touch controls are working perfectly and the resolution is a lot better. Keep up the good work, can't wait to see what else is added.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content:
Thank you, I am aware the difficulty is too high at the moment and I am going to adjust that.
Stay tuned!

title: Has potential

author: Tim Jacobs
comment: Doesn't work at all for me, using HTC M8 and LG G watch. The app on the watch doesn't respond to any touch.

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you, it is now definitely fixed. Please, try again and change your rating.

title: Doesn't work at all

author: Ross McDougall
comment: Just got a G Watch and really liked this concept. I'm a bit fan of turn based dungeon crawlers from my day on Amiga.   The menus are a bit slow to respond but I'm sure that will be better over time.   One recommendation I have is to make it a bit 'lighter' It took me over 5 mins to set up a new character and get into the dungeon. Which itself might be my entire commute.   Once I was in I really started enjoying it. But yeah, maybe a ''lighter' introduction, perhaps pre set characters/groups or a more streamlined 'new game' process. It'll assist new users who are simply wanting to kill a short amount of time :)

reply.author: AQ
reply.content: Thank you. The "quick game" has been added in version 0.1.20. It quickly and randomly generates a full weighted and equipped party ready to wander in the maze (you will notice the alignment rules might be broken in the quick party mode, but this will be fixed very soon). Stay tuned!

title: Great concept, looking forward to seeing more!

author: Benoît `BoD` Lubek
comment: And very fun to play a real game on such a tiny device!
title: Excellent graphics!

author: Hex DSL
comment: When will we be seeing some updates for this?
title: Okay game but updates?
